Authors: Jamjan Meeboon, Susumu Takamatsu, Uwe Braun
Title:
Morphophylogenetic analyses revealed that Podosphaera
tridactyla constitutes a species complex
Keywords:
Erysiphales, evolution, molecular analyses, powdery
mildews, ribosomal DNA
Abstract:
Podosphaera tridactyla (s. lat.) is a powdery mildew
species occurring on a wide range of Prunus spp. almost worldwide. In
the course of this study, we have investigated the phylogeny of the Po.
tridactyla complex with special emphasis on potential aspects of cryptic
speciation. The results suggested that Po. tridactyla represents a
species complex consisting of at least twelve different species. Based
on detailed morphological examinations and molecular sequence analyses,
we propose to divide Po. tridactyla s. lat. into ten species,
encompassing seven new species (Po. ampla, Po. pruni-avium, Po.
pruni-cerasoidis, Po. prunigena, Po. pruni-lusitanicae, Po. prunina, Po.
pruni-japonicae) and three known species (Po. longiseta, Po. salatai and
Po. tridactyla s. str.). Oidium passerinii on Pr. laurocerasus is
confirmed as a synonym of Po. tridactyla. Epitypes are designated for
Po. tridactyla and Oidium passerinii. Detailed morphological
examinations of the two Podosphaera taxa on Pr. cerasifera and Pr.
persica from Australia are still needed to draw final taxonomic
conclusions.
